div.div:
NIEMatron - March 30, 2012 - Version 2.0
Perfect for Work
Best money spent on an app. Makes my tablet a work tool for grab-and-go to meetings knowing my files are invisibly synchronized between my PC and Nook Color.

Cptnodegard - May 12, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 2.0
Works great
But could be better. Subtracting a star for settings that are either missing, or global when they should be syncpair-specific, like hidden file setting, file size limit, and file type limits. The filter can only do so much. Still, awesome app

Tom - April 11, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 2.0
Great app
Transformer T101 ~ As a PC user I think that this app is great value for the money. I think that Android user are spoilt. Does what it states on the tin and then some. BRAVO!!! Wish all apps were this good.

Tim - April 11, 2012 - Motorola Droid RAZR with version 2.0
Excellent! Needs Minor Tweaks:
Overall excellent. Only needs to allow filtering (lots of errors for meta like thumbs.db) and delta/block copy mode.

K Michael - April 3, 2012 - Version 2.0
Perfect
Worth every cent. Simple to use. Keeps my Phone, two tablets, two Laptops in sync. Every document I create or edit is automatically available on all my devices. DropBox is now fully integrated into my Digital world. Thank you TTXAPPS

Alex - May 25, 2012 - HTC Thunderbolt with version 2.0
This completely makes dropbox usable on android
This is the first and likely only application I will ever buy. I saw it went on sale and had to jump on it. The official dropbox app is crap without this addition. This makes your phone REALLY 2-way sync, and not just upload to dropbox! Sugarsync has similar capabilities in its official app, but it's horribly made and constantly syncs files that have not been modified. Thank you!!!

Shvetaketu - April 1, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 2.0
Works beautifully!
Works very well, immediate upload of altered files. Love it!

Simon - March 27, 2012 - Version 2.0
Expensive, but worth it
I'd never advocate spending this much money for a single application, let alone one that offers a feature that can easily be replaced by the developers of the original app, but this is worth every penny. It works flawlessly, is completely transparent, and is dead fast. As for the feature being replaced by Dropbox someday, after struggling with the miserable Android client, I can be assured that there is no way that the Dropbox developers have a chance of replacing this featureset. Purchase away.

Stephen - April 11, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 2.0
Great App for On the Go Development
I use this app all the time for web development. All of my web projects are stored on dropbox and sync between my computer and tablet for coding when I am out and about. Sometimes it does seem to stop syncing when there are large numbers of changed/added files, but it starts again at the next scheduled sync period. Overall, a must have app for anyone who uses dropbox.

bill - March 19, 2012 - Motorola Droid RAZR with version 2.0
Great but pay attention during setup
Excellent product. Best way I know of to keep phone, multiple tablets, and computers fully synced. You can adjust the file size, wifi only, and a number of other features, like automatically uploading pictures. This is a critical feature if you want drop box files synced to your device for use when no signal is available!

David - May 12, 2012 - Version 2.0
Problem with large files?
I usually have no problems with Dropsync Pro, but for the past few days it hasn't been able to download a 587.5 MB file from Dropbox. The sync history has several entries saying that the download failed and the sync was interrupted. I've successfully sync'ed a file about half that size in the past. Other than this, Dropsync Pro has worked flawlessly. I hope this can be resolved soon.

Danny - April 25, 2012 - Motorola Droid with version 2.0
Works Perfectly!
Found one more reason to love my Motorola Droid; Having an effective Dropbox app that does its job and does it right! If you are a serious Dropbox and Android user, stop reading this comment and get Dropsync now!

zero - May 26, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 2.0
some folder couldn't sync
some folder couldn't sync don't really know why, I will request refund.

Xandel - March 20, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 2.0
I love it!
Works flawlessly on my HTC Desire HD. I use it for my downloads folder and my DCIM picture folder. Note: Choose to sync hidden folders too so you can refresh your Gallery display by emptying the .thumbnails folder out from your pc after pulling pictures off your phone.

Kazi - June 13, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 2.0
does not work
it does no syncing. when it did, there were a lot of conflicts. No help from suppor even after reminders.

Matthew - May 5, 2012 - Version 2.0
Large files
I love the app, but it doesn't seem to be able to sync large files. The description says "Upload files larger than 5 MB". It doesn't say anything about a file size limit. If there is one, that should definitely be added to the app description.

JP - April 2, 2012 - Version 2.0
Simply Awesome!
Bough it to support the developer. Works great on HTC Rezound. With super fast 4G and unlimited data I don't have to worry about losing data due to a faulty memory card.

Chris - May 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 2.0
Excellent!
This is a must-have app for Dropbox users. If only the official Dropbox app was half as polished/useful!

Shari P. Erickson - June 13, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 2.0
Great app.Great deal
Thank you. Does exactly what I need.

Siraprapa - June 10, 2012 - Lenovo Indigo with version 2.0
Well done
I have phone, tablet and pc, and i have work and study stuff to carry around. Life is much easier with this app! Great jobs! Thanks!

April 26, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF201 with version 2.0
Writer
Now I can work on the server and the transformer. Irene

Nickname unavailable - May 28, 2012 - Samsung Nexus S with version 2.0
Loved it instantly
Works perfectly, no BS. Adds the functionality dropbox lacks.

Joseph - June 11, 2012 - Version 2.0
Awesome app
Needed this application for a customer and bought it for myself also. Missing one thing, widget that I can click and manually sync. Other than that awesome!

moiz - April 8, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 2.0
Meh
It's just expensive.

Daniel - May 7, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 2.0
Too expensive
Only supports dropbox and is severely lacking in features and settings compared to 'FolderSync' which is half the price!! Get FolderSync instead!

Gavin - June 9, 2012 - HTC Desire S with version 2.0
Money well spent
Works perfectly. How the official Dropbox app should be.

Chris - March 27, 2012 - Version 2.0
Good Buy
Works just like it should. Two way sync of only the folders you want. A little pricy, but worth it.

John - June 3, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 2.0
One word review
Glorious

Rubén - May 2, 2012 - Version 2.0
One of The most useful apps

Allos - March 20, 2012 - HTC G2 with version 2.0
Perfect
The one that works.....

j - April 11, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 2.0
Great
Samsung Note

TooFatKat - June 18, 2012 - Version 2.0
Captivate. What Dropbox for Android should have been.
Love instant uploads of pics, attachments, etc. Changes are always on the other machines I use. Makes my Captivate part of my office. Recommended

James - February 22, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 1.69
Indispensable dropbox addition
Incredibly good developer support. This excellent app does everything it says, and does it well. Be aware that file datestamp issues are a failing of dropbox, not this app. Also note that remotely deleting pics/music may leave orphaned index entries for the now missing file in the gallery/music app. This is a bug in android, not this app! Use SDrescan app to fix if necessary. Unchecking 'instant upload' will minimize this, if a nuisance, by giving a chance to locally delete bad pics, just taken, before they get onto other devices, only to be deleted by the app leaving a dead index entry there. This is a first-class app and a must for any dropbox user.

Michael - March 13, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.69
Perfect
Hey Joel Fabiani, don't you know what files you've updated/deleted on desktop/phone? Anyway, you can find that in your history on the dropbox website! I can't find a flaw in this app...

Jacob - February 24, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF201 with version 1.69
Perfect
Why doesn't dropbox just come with this? Great app.

BenRogersWPG - March 19, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.69
Automatic Sync, I Love It!
Now I have access to ask my files anywhere I go! I love how it can sync to your hot swappable SD card, and automatically upload camera photos.

Eric - March 18, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.69
Works for now as long as file size doesn't exceed
Works for now as long as file size doesn't exceed a certain size, somewhere above 300mb.

Rolo - March 22, 2012 - Droid Bionic with version 1.69
What I had been looking for.

Jon - March 12, 2012 - Motorola Droid X with version 1.69
works
makes it work like desktop version

r - March 16, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.69
Misleading
Can't believe I spent this money in this app. Keeps downloading everything I upload Back to my phone.

Bonoventura - March 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.69
Perfect!
When I found this program I just say wow this is amazing and I can't imagine anymore how to work without it. Recommend to everyone who's using dropbox.

Tom - March 2, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 1.69
Could not work without
Works amazingly, would recommend

Rick - February 28, 2012 - HTC Thunderbolt with version 1.69
Dropbox ahould includw this app.
This the way dropbox is supposed to work.

Robert - February 21, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.69
It just works

Jonathan - February 15, 2012 - Version 1.7
awesome app
App does everything it says it does and does it well. Initially I was seeing a problem where I was getting the message "autosync not allowed", emailed the developer who responded RIGHT AWAY and suggested it was might be my power condition setting (ie, set not to sync if power was below 80%). Turns out that was the issue. Very impressed with the app and developer responsiveness

Johnroy - December 5, 2011 - Version 1.7
Great app & great developers
Dropsync is the epitome of syncing apps. I had a minor issue with the Pro version's multiple folder syncing, but 2 hours after I emailed the developer, they had it fixed. At first, I bought the Pro version for multiple folders, but I would buy it again to thank the developers.

leperMessi@h - August 31, 2011 - HTC Desire S with version 1.7
Excellent app. Very useful. I manage my photos, music, pdfs and other data on ...
Excellent app. Very useful. I manage my photos, music, pdfs and other data on my computer; the syncing is left upto the app! :D HTC Desire S

Dani - November 29, 2011 - Version 1.7
If you use Dropbox you NEED Dropsync!
This is how the official Dropbox app. should be, lightweight and efficient. I would not use Dropbox if it weren't for Dropsync. What's the point of downloading files if they don't sync back to Dropbox once I edit them?? I don't really need the PRO version but I got the PRO Key just to reward the hard work of the programmer. Oh, and once you go Dropsync, you don't need the official Dropbox app anymore!! :)

Jay - January 5, 2012 - Version 1.7
Works as stated! Dev is very responsive!
This app is great and keeps my data backed up to my desktop. Dropbox is great but selecting individual files is a pain so this app comes in very handy and syncs regularly. I emailed the developer asking about a one-way sync and I received a response back almost immediately that this option is in the works. A quick response from the developer means a lot and gave me the confidence to purchase the Pro version. Works great in ICS (Galaxy Nexus).

Stu - October 27, 2011 - HTC Desire S with version 1.7
Superb, works perfect. Full, reliable 2 way sync. Take a picture, within minutes ...
Superb, works perfect. Full, reliable 2 way sync. Take a picture, within minutes its on my pc desktop.

esplinr - December 20, 2011 - Version 1.7
Works well
Only needed to purchase once to sync my phone and my tablet with my computer. Developer responded quickly with a fix when Dropbox changed their API and broke things. Appears reliable. Pro Key was worth it.

Cat - January 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.7
Worth every penny.
Love the auto sync for multiple folders. Works perfectly. Great job!!! Wish I had bought this sooner.

Sebastien - January 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.7
Great app!
Saved me from the Dropbox Xmas update disaster... However, comment below is true: we need a fresh icon ;-)

Chris - December 19, 2011 - Samsung Moment with version 1.7
Indispensible
There are only a handful of apps that I absolutely must have on my phone and Dropsync is one of them. I use it for syncing passwords with Keepass between my PCs and phone, syncing my Kindle book library to the Android Kindle app and so much more. The time it saves me from not having to manage the hundred+ passwords I need for work and my personal use alone makes this app a lifesaver. Spring the $4.49 for this app. You won't regret it.

David - December 7, 2011 - HTC Evo 4G with version 1.7
Worth every penny
I don't mind paying for apps when they work as well as this. It works exactly as advertised. The interface is clean, it's easy to set up, and it is very stable. I can't say that about any other dropbox sync app I've tried. The Tasker/Locale plugin is just the icing on the cake.

Rich - September 14, 2011 - HTC Incredible 2 with version 1.7
Excellent! I used trial version for weeks before deciding if I really wanted Pro. ...
Excellent! I used trial version for weeks before deciding if I really wanted Pro. Now that I've upgraded I'm really glad I did!

Jeggen - December 8, 2011 - Version 1.7
Overall fantastic... hope for one improvement
Great app, especially for my wi-fi only tablet. Nice to have ability to fully sync to Dropbox like on a PC, especially when you have storage space to do so. Not really fair to provide a low rating just b/c you think the pro license is too expensive. It's well worth it for the price of offline access... if you don't agree, just use Dropbox. One feature it should have is ability to sync all except one or two folders. I'd like to sync my photo folder with Dropbox for the pictures taken with my phone but then also sync fully my Dropbox account. The problem now is that I either need to setup about 20 individual sync folders to do this or end up with my photos being duplicated. (E.g. uploaded to Dropbox because of one setting and downloaded again into my full Dropbox download folder.) I wish I could setup one sync for photos and one that would automatically sync all remaining folders to a general Dropbox folder.

Gary - July 22, 2011 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.7
Perfect fix for Dropbox
This completes the Dropbox solution on your phone. Expensive, but I use Dropbox so much that not syncing to the phone was a problem. No longer. This works great

Nuno - November 1, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.7
Great app
Suggestions for a future release: - toggle to sync sub-folders (for each configured sync folders) - I have 2 sync folders on my device and on one of them I don't need sub folders. - sync log to see which files were removed / added / updated

Mariel - February 16, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.7
Good
It is more expensive than what a. Market shows but until now has been perfect. :)

Matt - December 11, 2011 - Version 1.7
AMAZING App!
This app ups the effectiveness of Dropbox 500% by allowing you to sync ENTIRE folders (not just individual files). I sync back ups off my sd card, all of my pictures and lots of other stuff now with one button press. I seriously can't recommend this app enough!

sumakair - February 6, 2012 - HTC Evo 4G with version 1.7
Dropsync is just what I needed!
Awesome! Automatic! Amazing! Accurate!

Gina - January 23, 2012 - Motorola Droid X with version 1.7
Simplify Your Digital Life
I use this solely to sync phone pics between computers. Has really helped keeping on track with P365. Can see lots of other uses.

ed - September 3, 2011 - Motorola Droid X with version 1.7
YMMV
YYMV Could not seem to get it working right. Needs a one-way sync. Foldersync worked better for me. YMMV

oxfordslacker - November 11, 2011 - HTC G2 with version 1.7
I love Dropbox, and this app makes it work properly on Android. No idea ...
I love Dropbox, and this app makes it work properly on Android. No idea why Dropbox themselves couldn't do this, but I'm glad that Dropsync have...

hotdog12 - February 8, 2012 - HTC Droid Incredible with version 1.7
This app kicks bootie!
The free version was so good I invested in the paid. Essential Dropbox add-on.

Rob - November 16, 2011 - Samsung Droid Charge with version 1.7
Good app
Works great, best way to cloudify your phone there is

Sardonic - December 24, 2011 - Version 1.7
Works as Described
...and the dev responds FAST! Had a small issue, now resolved. Every feature works on a Galaxy Nexus just as perfectly as photo stream works on my iPad.

Heine - September 5, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.7
Pity has good potential but it constantly creates conflicted files and keeps ...
Pity has good potential but it constantly creates conflicted files and keeps resyncing the same files. Uninstalling

Danny - February 26, 2012 - Motorola Droid 3 with version 1.7
This is What Dropbox Should Be
This app is what Dropbox should be. I love that it allows me to customize what syncs, when, and over which data connections. It is totally worth the money.

PaulQ - December 18, 2011 - Version 1.7
Exactly what I wanted and it works!
This sync app works and it's well worth the money. Support developers like this! - Rezound

Rick - August 9, 2011 - Version 1.7
Update
The latest version fixes my major complaint (no autosync on 4G). With that fixed, this a 5 star app and well worth the pro key price if you're looking for this functionality

Orman - October 1, 2011 - Motorola Droid Pro with version 1.7
Must have app
Now my phone - computer - tablet are one!

M - December 2, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy Tab with version 1.7
Works like a charm!
Great app that just works! Excellent developer response.

Leo Marcus - December 15, 2011 - SEMC Xperia Arc S with version 1.7
Nice job
Need more custom syncing settings. Like one way sync and file priority

Clauspeter - February 1, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.7
A very good application.
I installed the free app yesterday and it worked nice. I bought the full version there after in order to enable unlimited file size and multiple folder synchronization. Works perfect and smooth! good job!

mrbrianking - November 18, 2011 - Version 1.7
New version screwed up on my Droid X
I am having 2 problems. 1) Dropsync now says that autosync isn't allowed. 2) When trying to manually force it to sync, the syncing quits if the screen turns off. Please fix!

Renata - July 30, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy Tab with version 1.7
Wont login "network error com.a.a.m: HTTP/ 1.1 403 forbidden" galaxy tab, 5 star on ...
Wont login "network error com.a.a.m: HTTP/ 1.1 403 forbidden" galaxy tab, 5 star on other device

F - September 23, 2011 - HTC EVO 3D with version 1.7
Finally! Android now has file sync. So far, perfect two-way sync of over 50 ...
Finally! Android now has file sync. So far, perfect two-way sync of over 50 subdirectories and 1,500 files including deletions. HTC 3D

Joshua - February 15, 2012 - Version 1.7
Does what you expect
Little pricey but doing exactly what you would expect from a syncing program is worth the price.

User 989 - December 2, 2011 - HTC EVO 3D with version 1.7
Just upgraded... Won't populate DropBox folder list. So I can't sync another ...
Just upgraded... Won't populate DropBox folder list. So I can't sync another folder :(

Edward - November 24, 2011 - Droid Bionic with version 1.7
Perfect
Totally awesome. Exactly what is needed!!!

Love it
By far the best backup app around

sync now button
needs a SYNC NOW button on the main window, not in menu

Woodiah - October 13, 2011 - HTC EVO 3D with version 1.7
Worth
, the price for mutilpule and complete folder sync (including sub-folders).

Great Application, Great Suport. Perfect.

Ai-Narm - December 24, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy Tab with version 1.7
..
Icon is unacceptable, change it and get 5 stars

div.h4: WORKS GREAT! hers a good suggestion however...

div.p: only four stars however because i would like to be able to set upload connection type on a per folder basis. i would like to have my pictures upload instantly via wifi or cell data, but not my backup folder. that would make it a 5+ stars app. works great to sync my photos from my droid charge to my comp to my Gtab. many thanks!

chrisgl - March 22, 2012 - HTC G2
This is how it should be done. Choose folders to sync, select schedule & ...
This is how it should be done. Choose folders to sync, select schedule & how to sync. You are in control. New version has file history & more :) BUY!

Simply awesome for students!!!
